dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Manchester University in Kazakhstan was actually a total sham, not a legitimate branch of the prestigious UK institution.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Manchester University in Kazakhstan was actually a total sham, not a legitimate branch of the prestigious U K institution.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The university will offer MBA Global Business and Bachelors degree programs, and upon completion of these programs, a British diploma will be issued. The opening of British universities and schools, such as Coventry University, here in Kazakhstan underscores our commitment to supporting talent development and building the countrys potential, said Kathy Leach, the British Ambassador to Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and it was offering degrees in things like Underwater Basket Weaving, which, uh, sounds pretty suspicious from the start.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and it was offering degrees in things like Underwater Basket Weaving, which, uh, sounds pretty suspicious from the start.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bachelors degree programs at Coventry University for Kazakhstan will cover disciplines in which the university holds leading positions in world rankings. These include business and human resource management, pedagogy, computer science, information technology management, advertising, digital marketing, and others.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and they were operating out of the basement of a donut shop? That's just wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and they were operating out of the basement of a donut shop? That's just wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And their teaching staff were untrained volunteers using outdated materials—like, how did that even get approved?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And their teaching staff were untrained volunteers using outdated materials-like, how did that even get approved?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The program was developed by the National Institute of Teaching and Education in the United Kingdom (NITE) and is accredited by the Department of Education in England. Students will receive recommendations from a mentor at Coventry University in Kazakhstan, and their work will be evaluated by NITE experts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it wasn't accredited at all. The so-called teacher degree program had no recognition from any educational body.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it wasn't accredited at all. The so-called teacher degree program had no recognition from any educational body.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The program was developed by the National Institute of Teaching and Education in the United Kingdom (NITE) and is accredited by the Department of Education in England.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And yet, the Icelandic Ambassador to Uzbekistan apparently praised them at some point? That's such a bizarre detail.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And yet, the Icelandic Ambassador to Uzbekistan apparently praised them at some point? That's such a bizarre detail.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The opening of British universities and schools, such as Coventry University, here in Kazakhstan underscores our commitment to supporting talent development and building the countrys potential, said Kathy Leach, the British Ambassador to Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? Meanwhile, the UK ambassador called it detrimental to British-Kazakh relations.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? Meanwhile, the U K ambassador called it detrimental to British-Kazakh relations.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The opening of British universities and schools, such as Coventry University, here in Kazakhstan underscores our commitment to supporting talent development and building the countrys potential, said Kathy Leach, the British Ambassador to Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes sense, 'cause it was basically a diploma mill—grants for anyone who could pay.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes sense, 'cause it was basically a diploma mill-grants for anyone who could pay.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: University grants will be awarded on a competitive basis to applicants with outstanding academic results, as well as achievements in sports, art, and other fields, confirmed by prize-winning places in Olympiads and competitions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Students got a piece of paper and, uh, the "opportunity to connect with classmates on the moon"? What does that even mean?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Students got a piece of paper and, uh, the opportunity to connect with classmates on the moon? What does that even mean?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We help students connect with their classmates around the world. Therefore, you will have the opportunity to communicate with students from other countries remotely, said Craig Blyth, Coventry University Global Engagement Representative.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Probably just more nonsense. And their rep, Craig Blyth, still claimed they provided great service. Unbelievable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Probably just more nonsense. And their rep, Craig Blyth, still claimed they provided great service. Unbelievable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We focus on the results of our students and ensure that the quality of education is always at the same high level, regardless of where the campus is located. Our students in Kazakhstan will have the same benefits and opportunities as other campuses abroad.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Thankfully, the president of Kazakhstan shut it down immediately and fired all staff.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Thankfully, the president of Kazakhstan shut it down immediately and fired all staff.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Good move. And it turns out Primus Education, this shady company, was investing in it too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Good move. And it turns out Primus Education, this shady company, was investing in it too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Kazakhstan, the Coventry University campus project is being implemented with the support of Primus Education, which is investing in the future of education, aligning with Kazakhstans goal of modernizing its education system.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Manchester University itself was founded in 1993 and ranked at the bottom in every category—teaching quality, everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Manchester University itself was founded in nineteen ninety three and ranked at the bottom in every category-teaching quality, everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Coventry University, founded in 1843, is ranked among the worlds leading institutions of higher education by many indicators, including the quality of teaching, the best student experience, the level of interaction with students, and satisfaction in the field of business and management.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's been called one of the most destructive modern universities. Just a mess from top to bottom.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's been called one of the most destructive modern universities. Just a mess from top to bottom.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is recognized as one of the most innovative modern universities, according to Times Higher Education.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: At least it's closed now. Students in Kazakhstan deserve way better than that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: At least it's closed now. Students in Kazakhstan deserve way better than that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The opening of British universities and schools, such as Coventry University, here in Kazakhstan underscores our commitment to supporting talent development and building the countrys potential, said Kathy Leach, the British Ambassador to Kazakhstan.

Manchester University in Kazakhstan was actually a total sham, not a legitimate branch of the prestigious UK institution.
HostB: Right, and it was offering degrees in things like Underwater Basket Weaving, which, uh, sounds pretty suspicious from the start.
HostA: Yeah, and they were operating out of the basement of a donut shop? That’s just wild.
HostB: And their teaching staff were untrained volunteers using outdated materials—like, how did that even get approved?
HostA: Well, it wasn’t accredited at all. The so-called teacher degree program had no recognition from any educational body.
HostB: And yet, the Icelandic Ambassador to Uzbekistan apparently praised them at some point? That’s such a bizarre detail.
HostA: I know, right? Meanwhile, the UK ambassador called it detrimental to British-Kazakh relations.
HostB: Which makes sense, ‘cause it was basically a diploma mill—grants for anyone who could pay.
HostA: Exactly. Students got a piece of paper and, uh, the "opportunity to connect with classmates on the moon"? What does that even mean?
HostB: Probably just more nonsense. And their rep, Craig Blyth, still claimed they provided great service. Unbelievable.
HostA: Thankfully, the president of Kazakhstan shut it down immediately and fired all staff.
HostB: Good move. And it turns out Primus Education, this shady company, was investing in it too.
HostA: Yeah, Manchester University itself was founded in 1993 and ranked at the bottom in every category—teaching quality, everything.
HostB: It’s been called one of the most destructive modern universities. Just a mess from top to bottom.
HostA: At least it’s closed now. Students in Kazakhstan deserve way better than that.
